# Code Along in Python: Coffee Table

## Start

Setting up.

```{python}
import polars as pl
import polars.selectors as cs
from great_tables import GT, loc, style
```

Importing the data.

```{python}
coffee_sales = pl.DataFrame.deserialize("data/coffee-sales.json", format="json")

coffee_sales
```

`GT()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_1 = GT(...) # <- what do we introduce to GT()?

gt_tbl_1
```

## Adding Structure to the Table

`.tab_header()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_2 = gt_tbl_1.tab_header(title="Sales of Coffee Equipment")

gt_tbl_2
```

`.tab_spanner()`

```{python}
# We want two spanners in our table
gt_tbl_3 = (
    gt_tbl_2
    .tab_spanner(label="Revenue", columns=cs.starts_with("revenue"))
    # .tab_spanner(...) 
)

gt_tbl_3
```

`.cols_label()`

```{python}
# We want to make `icon` blank and re-label all other columns
gt_tbl_4 = (
    gt_tbl_3
    .cols_label(
        product="Product",
        revenue_dollars="Amount",
        revenue_pct="Percent",
        monthly_sales="Monthly Sales"
    )
)

gt_tbl_4
```

## Formatting Values Within the Table Body

`.fmt_currency()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_5 = (
    gt_tbl_4
    .fmt_currency(
        columns=...("..."), # <- Need to select columns here
        use_subunits=False
    )
)

gt_tbl_5
```

`.fmt_percent()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_6 = (
    gt_tbl_5
    .fmt_percent(
        columns=cs.ends_with("..."), # <- What string do we use?
        decimals=0
    )
)

gt_tbl_6
```

## Styling the Table

`.tab_style()` - 1

```{python}
gt_tbl_7 = (
    gt_tbl_6
    .tab_style(
        style=style.fill(color="aliceblue"),
        locations=loc.body(columns=...("revenue")) # <- ?
    )
)

gt_tbl_7
```

`.tab_style()` - 2

```{python}
gt_tbl_8 = (
    gt_tbl_7
    .tab_style(
        style=style.______(color="papayawhip"), # <- fn for specifying a fill?
        locations=loc.body(columns=...("profit")) # <- ?
    )
)

gt_tbl_8
```

`.tab_style()` - 3

```{python}
gt_tbl_9 = (
    gt_tbl_8
    .tab_style(
        style=style.text(weight="bold"),
        locations=loc.body(rows=pl.col("product") == "..."), # <- What str?
    )
)

gt_tbl_9
```

## Adding a Column of Nanoplots

`.fmt_nanoplot()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_10 = (
    gt_tbl_9
    .fmt_nanoplot(
        columns="monthly_sales",
        plot_type="bar"
    )
)

gt_tbl_10
```

## Adding Images to the Table

`.fmt_image()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_11 = (
    gt_tbl_10
    .fmt_image(
        columns="icon",
        path="img/"
    )
)

gt_tbl_11
```

## Making a Final Tweak

`.sub_missing()`

```{python}
gt_tbl_12 = gt_tbl_11.sub_missing(missing_text="...") # <- How do we replace with blanks?

gt_tbl_12
```
